h1: How Many Calories in a Chocolate Croissant?
assumptions: Standard bakery chocolate croissant (pain au chocolat), ~100 g, buttery pastry with chocolate filling, baked fresh.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bakery, size, brand, chocolate type, and added fillings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard chocolate croissant contains about 400 kcal and 8 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp butter on top before baking

faqs.q: How many calories in a chocolate croissant?
faqs.a: Approximately 400 kcal for a standard 100 g bakery version.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a chocolate croissant?
faqs.a: About 45 g total carbs, including 2 g fiber and 10 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is a chocolate croissant high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 22 g fat per croissant, with 12 g saturated fat from butter and chocolate.

faqs.q: How much protein in a chocolate croissant?
faqs.a: Roughly 8 g protein, mainly from the dough and any milk in chocolate.
